name: satirically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that criticizes people or ideas in a humorous way, especially in order to make a political point: Voltaire wrote satirically about religion in the 18th century. It's a satirically comic opera that has been performed hundreds of times.
More examplesFewer examplesThe show is a satirically funny look at the future of television.She is presented satirically in the opening section of the novel.His outrageous proposals are meant to be interpreted satirically.The film satirically portrays experts who deny global warming.
